required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retrospective Study to Capture Dosing and Treatment Outcome Data in Participants With Severe Congenital Protein C Deficiency Who Were Treated With Protein C Concentrate Under an Emergency Use IND
clinical_study.official_title: A Retrospective Study to Capture Dosing and Treatment Outcome Data in Subjects With Severe Congenital Protein C Deficiency Who Were Treated With Protein C Concentrate Under an Emergency Use IND

brief_summary.textblock: This is a data collection study with the purpose of capturing dosing and treatment outcome data in participants with severe congenital protein C deficiency who were treated with protein C concentrate under an Emergency Use Investigational New Drug Application (IND).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants who Received a Dose of Protein C in Retrospective Study
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period (up to 6 months)
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants who received a dose of Protein C in retrospective study will be reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Prophylactic Treatment Outcome
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period (up to 6 months)
primary_outcome.description: Participants experience any episodes of purpura fulminans (PF), coumarin induced skin necrosis (CISN), or thromboembolic event during prophylactic treatment will be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Acute Episode Treatment Outcome
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period (up to 6 months)
primary_outcome.description: Acute episode treatment outcome includes type of episode (PF, CISN, Thromboembolic); Was treatment effective or not effective; Was patient successfully transitioned to anticoagulation following the resolution of the episode will be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse Experiences (AEs) Related to Protein C Concentrate Treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period (up to 6 months)
primary_outcome.description: An AE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered study product that does not necessarily have a casual relationship with the treatment. AEs considered possibly or probably related to Protein C Concentrate treatment will be recorded on case report forms (CRFs).

arm_group.description: Participants with severe congenital protein C deficiency who were treated under an emergency use IND.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participant treated with protein C concentrate under a Baxter Healthcare Corporation Emergency Use IND.
- Participant with diagnosis of severe congenital protein C deficiency.
- Participant or parent/legally authorized representative has provided written informed consent.

link.description: To obtain more information on the study, click here/on this link.
